name: Drakesworn Templar
flavorText: Drakesworn Templars are rare souls, Stormcasts pure enough to forge a bond with a noble Stardrake. They are the lieutenants of the Extremis chambers, each capable of turning the tide of battle through their deeds.

name: Karazai the Scarred
flavorText: The savagery of Ghur has wormed its way into the Draconith lord Karazai’s twisted soul. The Scarred Prince now fights only to deal vengeance to his - and, when their purposes align, Sigmar’s - ancestral enemies.

name: Krondys Son of Dracothion
flavorText: The elder drake Krondys is lord to a broken people, but the Son of Dracothion remains unbowed. His magical prowess, aeons-old battlecraft and reptilian might is magnificent to behold, as is his conviction to restore his empire’s glory.

name: Lord Celestant on Stardrake
flavorText: Even amongst the noble Stormcasts, only the worthiest can hope to earn the respect of a Stardrake. The souls of man and beast are infused with celestial energies, able to harness the power of the cosmos themselves.

name: Astreia Solbright
flavorText: Lord-Arcanum Solbright of the Shimmersouls chamber wields the magics of the storm with remarkable proficiency. Mounted atop the Dracoline Kazra, she crackles with static charge, blasting enemies to cinders while leaving her allies unscathed.

name: Aventis Firestrike Magister of Hammerhal
flavorText: The Lord-Arcanum Firestrike is the most exalted Stormcast mage in Hammerhal. He rides a mighty Tauralon to war, and has within him a heart of primordial fire, enabling him to channel the energy of not only Azyr but also Aqshy.

name: Averon Stormsire
flavorText: A specialist in the sundering of dark enchantments, Knight-Incantor Stormsire is also acutely aware of the negative toll Reforging takes on a Stormcast’s soul, relentlessly searching for any form of cure in even the most hostile of locations.
pitchedBattleNotes: Unique. Averon Stormsire and Stormsire’s Cursebreakers must be taken as a set. Although taken as a set

name: Celestant Prime Hammer of Sigmar
flavorText: First of the Stormcasts, the Celestant-Prime embodies Sigmar’s storm. He descends with the force of the thunderbolt, wielding Ghal Maraz to strike down all in his path while summoning punishing meteor showers.

name: Gardus Steel Soul
flavorText: Gardus Steel Soul is the most revered Lord-Celestant of the Hallowed Knights and a veritable beacon of hope. In battle, he focuses his faith as a weapon to safeguard the innocent and smite Sigmar’s enemies.

name: Gavriel Sureheart
flavorText: Gavriel Sureheart is an unstoppable force of righteousness and liberation. The Lord-Celestant is only satisfied when on the attack, relentlessly leading from the front and cutting down his foes in a whirlwind of blows.

name: Knight Arcanum
flavorText: Members of the mysterious Valedictor temple, Knights-Arcanum are mages charged with protecting ancient lore. Many of their number are skilled in deadly arcano-meteorological sorceries, summoning squalls of thunderous power or downpours of purifying Azyrite energy.

name: Knight Azyros
flavorText: Where the winged Knights-Azyros travel, so too goes the light of Sigmar held within their lanterns. With this radiant glow, the Knights-Azyros cast back the foe even as they illuminate the path for their fellows.

name: Knight Draconis
flavorText: Only one who has truly bonded with a Draconith can become a Knight-Draconis. Such unity is symbolised by the flaming blades these champions wield, and they eagerly bring burning death to any foe that stands before them.

name: Knight Heraldor
flavorText: Thunderous notes resounding from their enchanted battle-horn, a Knight-Heraldor is an immovable beacon of defiance. So powerful are the clarion blasts they unleash that the resulting shockwave can topple buildings, uproot trees and shatter monoliths.

name: Knight Incantor
flavorText: The Knights-Incantor are veteran mages of the Sacrosanct chambers. With their powerful voices, they summon furious tempests and howling gales to unleash against the foe, wielding potent artefacts to nullify enemy sorceries.

name: Knight Judicator with Gryph hounds
flavorText: The masterful archers known as Knights-Judicator are akin to living artillery engines. Protected by their faithful Gryph-hound companions, they take up a commanding position early in the battle before raining pitiless, constant death from afar.

name: Knight Questor
flavorText: Sigmar himself dictates the missions of the Knights-Questor. These heroes will travel any distance and brave any danger to see their task done, meeting every challenge head on in their adventures across the realms.

name: Knight Relictor
flavorText: Knights-Relictor are fearsome warrior-clerics. As they spearhead the Stormcast advance, they burn the bones of saints and martyrs in holy censers, producing clouds of billowing incense that disrupt those who would call upon the powers of dark deities.

name: Knight Venator
flavorText: Not even the mightiest adversaries can escape the vengeance of a Knight- Venator. Accompanied by their faithful Star-eagles, these winged hunters prowl the skies with incredible swiftness, loosing blessed arrows that unerringly seek their targets.

name: Knight Vexillor
flavorText: To become a Knight-Vexillor, a Stormcast must pass repeated gruelling trials. Those who succeed are entrusted with the sacred banners of Azyr, relics that can transport warriors upon gale winds or call down rains of meteors.

name: Knight Vexillor with Banner of Apotheosis
flavorText: Knights-Vexillor clad in thunderstrike armour often bear a Banner of Apotheosis. Each of these holy standards is infused with the forge-magics of Grungni and can elevate the resilience of the Stormcasts to new heights.

name: Knight Zephyros
flavorText: The Knights-Zephyros serve as Sigmar’s assassins. Once a target is marked, they employ their god-wrought blessings to travel the winds aetheric and run down their prey, eventually overcoming them in a flurry of lightning-swift violence.

name: Lord Aquilor
flavorText: Lord-Aquilors are masters of the hunt, tracking their quarry alongside their Vanguard warriors. When the foe is cornered, the Aquilors strike with relentless precision, their fury delivered with the same savage swiftness as that of their Gryph-charger allies.

name: Lord Arcanum
flavorText: Lord-Arcanums are masters of the Sacrosanct chambers. In battle, they unleash storms of celestial force or employ strange spirit-sorceries to rebind the souls of fallen comrades to their bodies, allowing them to fight on.

name: Lord Arcanum on Celestial Dracoline
flavorText: Lord-Arcanums who ride Dracolines favour bombastic, aggressive magics above all. They are often found hurling spears of scouring elemental force into the foe’s ranks while their bestial companion lopes forward to pounce.

name: Lord Arcanum on Gryph charger
flavorText: It is not easy for a Lord-Arcanum to earn a Gryph-charger’s respect. Those who succeed gain an impossibly fleet mount, ensuring their sorceries can be unleashed wherever they are most needed.

name: Lord Arcanum on Tauralon
flavorText: Lord-Arcanums who ride Tauralons are masters of the heavens. From their lofty vantage point, they unleash a hurricane of Azyrite magics, while those who fight in their wake are invigorated by the magical wake left by the great winged beast.

name: Lord Castellant
flavorText: Masters of defensive warfare, the Lord-Castellants oversee the fortification of Sigmar’s empire. The mystical lanterns they carry are empowered by celestial energies, bolstering their wounded Stormcast brethren even as they hurl back the tainted foe.

name: Lord Celestant
flavorText: Commanders of the front-line chambers, Lord-Celestants go to war surrounded by the tempest’s glorious halo. They are inspiring figures to their warriors, who attack with redoubled fervour while emboldened by a Celesta nt’s heroic presence.

name: Lord Celestant on Dracoth
flavorText: Fuelled by the powers celestial, all Lord-Celestants are formidable warriors in their own right. When allied with the might of a Dracoth, they become all the more potent, tearing asunder all who oppose the God-King.

name: Lord Commander Bastian Carthalos
flavorText: Bastian Carthalos is Lord-Commander of the Hammers of Sigmar. Long has this noble soul served as Castellan of Azyr, but now he must unleash the power of the Great Bolt Skjordamar on the realms at large.

name: Lord Exorcist
flavorText: The bane of the daemon and the gheist, the mystical Lord-Exorcists hold great power over the cleansing of soul-stuff. With their magics, they banish unclean entities while saving the spirits of any who may prove redeemable.

name: Lord Imperatant
flavorText: Amongst the greatest of Sigmar’s strategists, a Lord-Imperatant’s most notable strength lies in their ability to lead their forces as one unstoppable war engine, orchestrating the foe’s downfall through booming commands.

name: Lord Ordinator
flavorText: Proficient in arcane engineering and the reading of portents, the Lord-Ordinators are a potent force. Such traits make them excellent artillery commanders, and they expertly direct the war machinery of their allies to annihilate their foes.

name: Lord Relictor
flavorText: Clad in sinister Mortis armour, the Lord-Relictors are grim soul-priests and mighty warriors both. For all their dour appearance, each is a true hero, their prayers channelling Sigmar’s power to be unleashed upon the battlefield.

name: Lord Veritant
flavorText: The feared Lord-Veritants are hunters of corruption. Alongside their faithful Gryph-hound companions, they stalk the warlock and the heretic, subjecting them to the purging light of their lanterns of abjuration before mercilessly striking them down.

name: Neave Blacktalon
flavorText: As swift as a lightning strike, Neave Blacktalon is utterly single-minded on the hunt. None are as adept at riding the winds aetheric as this pitiless assassin, who attacks before her prey ever sees her coming.

name: Vandus Hammerhand
flavorText: Lord-Celestant Vandus Hammerhand is a fabled hero of the Hammers of Sigmar. Mounted upon the Dracoth Calanax, this storied soul has led his Warrior chamber to countless victories despite even the most harrowing odds.

name: Yndrasta the Celestial Spear
flavorText: Yndrasta is a warrior of Sigmar’s inner circle, Reforged by the God-King’s own hand and charged with serving as his winged beastslayer. She is the terror of the monstrous and an inspiring sight to the forces of civilisation.

name: Errant Questor
description: An Errant-Questor is a single model. He is armed with a Rune-etched Greatblade.

abilities.name: Implacable Determination
abilities.flavorText: Until his oath is fulfilled, an Errant-Questor’s will is such that he is all but inviolable.
abilities.description: When you make save rolls for an Errant-Questor, ignore the enemy’s Rend characteristic.

abilities.name: Relentless Purpose
abilities.description: You can re-roll failed charge rolls for an Errant-Questor.

name: Lynus Ghalmorian on Gryph Charger
flavorText: The Lord-Arcanum of the Sempiternals is a master of both aetheric and amethyst magic. Mounted on his Gryph-charger Katafalq he courses into battle, determined to atone for past failures and bring ruin to those who would prey on the innocent.
description: Lynus Ghalmorian is a named character that is a single model. He is armed with an Aetherstave.

characteristics.name: MOUNT
characteristics.description: Lynus Gryph-charger, Katafalq, attacks with its Razor Beak and Claws.

abilities.name: Aethereal Strike
abilities.flavorText: A Gryph-charger’s claws are supernaturally sharp, tearing through armour with ease.
abilities.description: If the unmodified hit roll for an attack made with a Gryph-charger’s Razor Beak and Claws is 6, that attack inflicts 1 mortal wound on the target and the attack sequence ends (do not make a wound or save roll).

abilities.name: Cycle of the Storm
abilities.flavorText: A Lord-Arcanum is capable of capturing the soul-stuff of a fallen Stormcast Eternal, returning it back to the battlefield to continue the fight.
abilities.description: Once per turn, when a friendly STORMCAST ETERNAL model is slain within 18" of this model, instead of removing the slain model, you can heal 1 wound allocated to it. This model cannot use this ability on itself.

abilities.name: Ride the Winds Aetheric
abilities.flavorText: Gryph-chargers can move faster than the eye can follow along the winds aetheric, though the shifting of these winds makes such movement perilous at times.
abilities.description: In your movement phase, this model can Ride the Winds Aetheric instead of moving normally. If it does so, choose the direction in which it will move, and roll 6D6. This model can move up to a number of inches equal to the result in the direction chosen, moving over terrain and other models as if it could fly. It must end the move more than 3" from enemy models - if this is impossible, it cannot move at all. This model cannot charge in a turn in which it Rides the Winds Aetheric.

abilities.name: Spirit Flask
abilities.flavorText: As a desperate last resort, Lord Arcanums can smash open one or more of the filled spirit flasks that they carry, causing a deadly explosion of soul energy that engulfs the wizard and anybody that is nearby.
abilities.description: Once per battle, at the start of the combat phase, you can say that this model will shatter 1, 2 or 3 spirit flasks. If you do so, each unit within 3" of this model suffers 1 mortal wound for each spirit flask that was shattered. Units within 3" with 10 or more models suffer D3 mortal wounds for each spirit flask that was shattered instead. Allocate the mortal wounds to this model last of all, after allocating them to any other units that are affected.

abilities.name: Shield of the Pale Knight
abilities.flavorText: Embedded with the bones of a long-dead saint, this invictunite relic radiates protective power.
abilities.description: You can re-roll save rolls of 1 for attacks made with missile weapons that target this model or any friendly ANVILS OF THE HELDENHAMMER units wholly within 12" of this model.

abilities.name: Arcane BoltMystic ShieldAmethyst GalePrime Electrids
abilities.description: This model is a WIZARD. He can attempt to cast one spell in your hero phase, and attempt to unbind one spell in the enemy hero phase. He knows the Arcane Bolt, Mystic Shield and Amethyst Gale spells. In addition, the Arcane Bolts that this model unleashes are fuelled by Prime Electrids.

abilities.name: Amethyst Gale
abilities.flavorText: A hurricane of deathly energy rushes from the Lord-Arcanums aetherstave, tearing through the enemy ranks and leaving them in terrified disarray.
abilities.description: Amethyst Gale has a casting value of 6. If successfully cast, pick an enemy unit within 12" of the caster that is visible to them. That unit suffers D3 mortal wounds. In addition, until your next hero phase, subtract 1 from hit rolls for attacks made by that unit.

abilities.name: Prime ElectridsArcane Bolt
abilities.flavorText: With the power of Azyr crackling through them, Lord-Arcanums can summon lightning as easily as another mortal draws breath.
abilities.description: Prime Electrids: If this model successfully casts Arcane Bolt and it is not unbound, then the spell inflicts D3 mortal wounds instead of 1, or D6 mortal wounds instead of D3 if the casting roll was 10+.

abilities.name: Sombre Exemplar
abilities.flavorText: Ghalmorian is master of the Sempiternals, leading his chamber from the front with a grave-cold devotion to duty.
abilities.description: You can use this command ability at the start of the combat phase. If you do so, until the end of that phase add 1 to hit rolls for attacks made by friendly ANVILS OF THE HELDENHAMMER units while they are wholly within 12" of this model.

name: Judicators with Boltstorm Crossbows
flavorText: Judicators who wield boltstorm crossbows are adept in the culling of enemy hordes. These rapid-firing weapons launch ammunition tipped with blessed sigmarite; by the time these strike home, they are thoroughly enveloped in coruscating storm-energies.

name: Judicators with Skybolt Bows
flavorText: No foe can escape the keen gaze of the Judicators. Granted the ability to sense corruption, the storm of arrow fire unleashed by their skybolt bows fells ranks of enemies with relentless and merciless precision.

name: Liberators
flavorText: Countless tyrants have fallen to the Liberators. These staunch souls are the most famed Redeemer warriors; whether forming implacable shieldwalls or expertly wielding paired weapons, they are undeniably the soul of the Stormhost made manifest.

name: Sequitors
flavorText: Arcane mystery clings to the Sequitors, footsoldiers of the Sacrosanct chambers. By channelling celestial power through their wargear, they can bolster their strength to new heights, all the while carrying out the secretive missions of their hosts.

name: Vanquishers
flavorText: Vanquishers are expert swordsmen, warrior-knights for whom the skillful kill is everything. They excel at cleaving through armoured foes and milling hordes both, wielding their celestial greatswords to hack down any enemy that dares approach.

name: Vindictors
flavorText: The Vindictor retinues are the shieldwall upon which the forces of ruin shatter. These warriors will hold their ground come what may, trusting in their lightning-blessed wargear and their own skill to devastate the foe.

name: Aetherwings
flavorText: Native to Azyr, Aetherwings hunt with terrific swiftness. Their bonds with the Storm casts are close, and in battle, they soar high above the fray before diving to savage their foes with flashing claws and beaks.

name: Annihilators
flavorText: The Annihilators are dispatched to unleash Sigmar’s own destructive wrath. These hulking goliaths are often held to be immortal by onlookers; they arrive on the battlefield in a crushing sidelong charge, shattering all before them.

name: Annihilators with Meteoric Grandhammers
flavorText: Annihilators armed with meteoric grandhammers are a terror. Anything caught in the crushing swings of these weapons is reduced to ruin, the Annihilators showing neither pity nor remorse as they go about their brutal business.

name: Castigators
flavorText: When beings born of the aether rear their heads, it is the Castigators who put them down. Channelling celestial powers through their thunderhead greatbows, they provide covering fire to their kindred, projectiles detonating with blazing force.

name: Decimators
flavorText: The advance of the Decimators is marked by piles of butchered corpses. These Paladins are remorseless in eradicating Sigmar’s enemies and, armed with their brutal thunderaxes, never tire when cleaving through hordes of the hateful foe.

name: Dracothian Guard Concussors
flavorText: Foremost warriors of the Thunderwave echelon, Concussors and their Dracoth mounts are chosen for their raw brawn. Theirs is the task of humbling the foe ready for the ultimate strike, and their hammers are feared by all.
pitchedBattleNotes: Battleline in a Hammers of Sigmar army

name: Dracothian Guard Desolators
flavorText: To the Desolators falls the honour of eradicating the enemies of the Extremis chambers. Neither they nor their Dracoths heed any desperate calls for mercy, and their thunderaxes take a fearsome toll with each swing.
pitchedBattleNotes: Battleline in a Hammers of Sigmar army

name: Dracothian Guard Fulminators
flavorText: Fulminators are the most aggressive Dracothian Guard, the vaunted speartip of the Lightning echelon. As their ground-shaking charge builds speed, a tempest of energy surrounds their lances, ready to be unleashed as they crash home.
pitchedBattleNotes: Battleline in a Hammers of Sigmar army

name: Dracothian Guard Fulminators Single
flavorText: Fulminators are the most aggressive Dracothian Guard, the vaunted speartip of the Lightning echelon. As their ground-shaking charge builds speed, a tempest of energy surrounds their lances, ready to be unleashed as they crash home.
pitchedBattleNotes: Single. You can include 1 unit of this type for each Lord-Celestant on Dracoth you include in your army. This unit cannot have the Battleline battlefield role.

name: Dracothian Guard Tempestors
flavorText: To become a Tempestor, a Stormcast must prove themselves a master marksman, maintaining pinpoint fire even while fighting atop a fierce Dracoth. Their volleystorm crossbows spit a constant stream of blazing death into the foe.
pitchedBattleNotes: Battleline in a Hammers of Sigmar army

name: Evocators
flavorText: Armed with sword and stave, Evocators are masterful warriors. Their true strength, however, lies in harnessing Azyr’s mystical energies to summon chain lightning arcs that scour the foe or infusing their allies with tempestuous strength.

name: Evocators on Celestial Dracolines
flavorText: Dracolines are fearsome beasts of Azyr whose roars can unman even the staunchest foes. When their savagery is allied with the magical prowess of an Evocator, the result is a force to be reckoned with.

name: Gryph hounds
flavorText: Gryph-hounds are amongst the noblest Azyrite beasts and have long been companions of the Stormhosts. Their sharp senses are capable of detecting hidden foes, while their fearsome talons are the bane of the unwary.

name: Praetors
flavorText: Praetors are exemplary bodyguards, linked to their assigned wards at an arcane, spiritual level. This connection allows the Praetor to accept the wounds of their charge unto themselves, keeping Sigmar’s champions hale and whole.
description: Each model in a Praetors unit is armed with a Soulguard's Halberd.

characteristics.name: CHAMPION
characteristics.description: 1 model in this unit can be a Praetor-Prime. Add 1 to the Attacks characteristic of that model's Soulguard's Halberd.

name: Prosecutors with Celestial Hammers
flavorText: Prosecutors are winged heralds who soar above the battlefield upon wings of starlight. Wielding enchanted hammers that are summoned directly from the tempest, they rain down a constant barrage of death upon the foe.

name: Prosecutors with Stormcall Javelins
flavorText: Prosecutors armed with stormcall javelins are amongst the most daring warriors of the celestial host. Fearlessly, they hurtle forward to meet the enemy, hurling blessed projectiles into their midst before descending to eradicate the survivors.

name: Protectors
flavorText: As a Protector retinue advances, they spin their stormstrike glaives in intricate arcs. By doing so, they create shields of celestial force, safeguarding their comrades while the Paladins eagerly put their warrior skills to work.

name: Retributors
flavorText: A Retributor retinue wields crushing lightning hammers, amongst the most unsubtle and devastating weaponry in the Stormhosts’ arsenal. By channelling the storm’s fury through these fearsome weapons, the Retributors strike the foe with annihilating force.

name: Steelheart s Champions
flavorText: The Liberator retinue known as Steelheart’s Champions embodies the resolute heroism of the Hammer of Sigmar. They have earned countless battle honours, and few foes cannot be overcome by the strength of their fellowship.

name: Stormdrake Guard
flavorText: The Stormdrake Guard are the result of the alliance between Azyr and the Draconith. In battle, they are holy terrors, the Stormcasts fighting with consummate skill while the drakes’ burning breath and vicious claws annihilate their foes.
pitchedBattleNotes: Battleline in a Stormcast Eternals army if general is a DRACONITH or STARDRAKE

name: Stormdrake Guard Single
flavorText: The Stormdrake Guard are the result of the alliance between Azyr and the Draconith. In battle, they are holy terrors, the Stormcasts fighting with consummate skill while the drakes’ burning breath and vicious claws annihilate their foes.
pitchedBattleNotes: Single. You can include 1 unit of this type for each Knight-Draconis you include in your army. This unit cannot have the Battleline battlefield role.

name: Stormsire s Cursebreakers
flavorText: The Evocators Ammis and Rastus have journeyed into many an unhallowed corner of the realms alongside their master and friend Averon Stormsire, wielding the crackling storm-magics of Azyr with a ferocious skill.
pitchedBattleNotes: Unique. Averon Stormsire and Stormsire’s Cursebreakers must be taken as a set. Although taken as a set

name: Stormstrike Chariot
flavorText: Swift war-carriages of the Angelos conclaves, Stormstrike Chariots are potent linebreakers. As they build up speed, they draw the energies of Azyr to themselves before unleashing them in thunderous blasts amidst the enemy ranks.

name: The Farstriders
flavorText: Sanson Farstrider is one of the most experienced Hunter-Primes in the Hammers of Sigmar. He and his band of veteran rangers specialise in undertaking the most critical and death defying of missions behind enemy lines.

name: Vanguard Hunters
flavorText: Vanguard-Hunters thrive when hunting their quarry through the most hostile environments. Carrying astral compasses to uncover hidden paths from which to strike, the daring exploits of these warriors has changed the course of many wars.

name: Vanguard Palladors
flavorText: Few other Stormcasts can hope to match the Palladors for speed. Their fleet Gryph-charger mounts make them excellent raiding forces, able to suddenly strike at a foe before any hope of resistance can be raised.

name: Vanguard Raptors with Hurricane Crossbows
flavorText: For some Vanguard-Raptors, Sigmar’s work can only be done by annihilating his foes in clinically rapid succession. Their hurricane crossbows facilitate this, able to unleash a withering salvo of death that few can withstand.

name: Vanguard Raptors with Longstrike Crossbows
flavorText: Vanguard-Raptors have few equals in matters of marksmanship. Aloof by nature, they wield their longstrike crossbows with astounding skill, striking down foes from an incredible distance like the hand of an avenging god.

name: Vigilors
flavorText: Clad in thunderstrike armour, Vigilors are skilled archers who fearlessly scout out a path for their brethren. Their arrows conjure brief flashes of lightning upon impact, a form of battle-cant that directs the advance of their kin.
pitchedBattleNotes: Battleline in a Stormcast Eternals army if general is a KNIGHT-JUDICATOR

name: Xandire s Truthseekers
flavorText: Armed with the Lantern Astrala, Calthia Xandire leads her fellows in search of Harrowdeep’s forgotten secrets. With her comes Dhoraz Giant-fell, who revels in each destructive swing of his hammer; Luxa Stormrider, who lets her proficiency with the bow speak for her; and Luxa’s aetherwing companion, Taros.

name: Celestar Ballista
flavorText: Mobile artillery of the Ordinatos conclaves, Celestar Ballistas are weapons of terrible power. Their Sacristan operators are skilled combat engineers, and the sigmarite bolts these weapons spit forth explode with the force of the thunderbolt.

name: Celestian Vortex
flavorText: A Celestian Vortex is a whirling tornado of Azyrite magic. Within this mystical typhoon swirl magical hammers cast in the image of Ghal Maraz. Any caught in the vortex’s path are soon shattered into oblivion.

name: Dais Arcanum
flavorText: Groundbound Stormcast mages forced to travel swiftly will summon a construct known as a Dais Arcanum. These mystical discs are empowered by the winds of Azyr, bolstering the arcane arts of any who stand upon them.

name: Everblaze Comet
flavorText: Everblaze Comets are nothing less than blessed meteors plucked from the firmament and sent hurtling onto the battlefield. Even after impact, these cosmic shards pulse with arcane power, disrupting nearby magics and incinerating anything in the vicinity

name: Godsmaw s Vanguard
flavorText: It is said that Brothgar Godsmaw’s appetite for food is exceeded only by the joy he finds in battle.Sometimes claimed by his fellow Stormcasts to have more in common with a grunta than a man, he laughs heartily as he strikes down his foes with punishing blows.

name: Lord Vorst s Retinue
flavorText: The remnants of the Auric Lions warrior chamber have been battered and bloodied, but still they stand defiant. Led by their indomitable commander, the Lord-Imperatant Tyberain Vorst, these golden champions have already seen harsh fighting in the Era of the Beast.
